quest.name: Return to the Phantom Realm
journal: Deryk betrays a gleam in his eyes at the sight of you.

Outside Revenant's Toll, Deryk informs you that G'raha Tia and Krile are on their way hither, having prepared for the next stage of your investigation of the phantom realm. They soon arrive, with the Miqo'te carrying the advanced-if-hefty aetheric analyzer borrowed from the Forum. This contraption will allow you to record detailed data of the gods' domain, to which end you set forth for the Omphalos, where your companion Snoegeim awaits.

Snoegeim has further studied the monument in the Omphalos, and found that the magic it harbors takes the form of an epigraph. The inscription is incomplete, however, and you must fill in the missing information if you are to decipher it. The mythologist suggests asking the gods themselves for help, and to everyone's surprise, Nophica appears in response to your whimsical charm. She promises you the key to unlocking the mystery, but in exchange you must do battle with more gods, herself included. The Matron then takes her leave, and you turn to discuss the developments with your comrades.

Though the original plan was to revisit the Heavens of Lightning and Fire, it is decided that you will prioritize Nophica's invitation and sally forth into the Heaven of Earth with G'raha Tia. As the Archon must focus on acquiring data with the aetheric analyzer, it falls to you to give the gods the battle they desire, and you prepare yourself for another grueling foray into their sanctum.

※Euphrosyne can be accessed via the Duty Finder.

As you did once before, you fight your way through the gods' heavenly domain, and bring the mighty beings to their knees. Your task thus accomplished, you and G'raha Tia make your way back to the Omphalos.

Gracing you with their presence once more, the gods reveal that the information you seek is contained within eternal stones scattered across Eorzea─stones which Snoegeim deduces are the marks of the Twelve. As G'raha Tia proposes splitting up to acquire the information, the divinities decide to accompany you. Having assumed their disguises, each chooses a member of your band as a traveling companion─though for some reason, you and Deryk appear to have been treated as a pair.
Deryk appears none too impressed with the gods' spontaneous demand. And for your part, you struggle to imagine what an adventure will be like in the company of the divine...

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Oh, greetings, Forename.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: If you've come to ask about developments in our phantom realm investigation, then your timing couldn't be better.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: A short while ago, I received word from G'raha Tia. He and Krile have completed their preparations in Sharlayan, and are ready to resume fieldwork.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Even as we speak, they make their way hither. Let's wait for them together, shall we?

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Ah, there they are.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant>

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: What in the heavens are you carrying?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: This, my friends, is the latest technological marvel to come out of Sharlayan...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I give you the aetheric analyzer!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Holding it thus, you take a measure of the ambient aether...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: ...Whose waveform is then recorded by the aetherotranscriber at the back. This provides us with detailed data of the environment, which we can study at our leisure.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: As you know, the phantom realms are hidden by illusions. In order to ascertain their nature, I suggested to Krile that we record the data with proper equipment.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Alas, said equipment is tremendously cumbersome. Raha has done well to bring it here in one piece, and as expensive as it doubtless is, I hope we can return it in the same condition...

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Return it?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Yes, to the Forum. In approving our investigation, they granted us use of the device in addition to their financial backing.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Despite the Students' greatly reduced scale, the Forum has faith in our endeavors─thus did the approval notice declare, I'm proud to say.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: We owe much of this goodwill to the Scions, yourself not least of all.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: That being said, we can't depend on the Forum indefinitely. No, we must stand on our own two feet again, and it begins with our efforts in this investigation.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: The Twelve are meant to be Eorzea's guardian deities, yet they seek battle with mankind. What could it possibly be that motivates them?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: In treating with them earnestly, I am hopeful that we will find the answer.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Well, we shouldn't keep Snoegeim waiting. Without further ado, let's join her in the Omphalos.

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Welcome back!

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Well now, if that isn't the aetheric analyzer! You've done well to get a hold of it!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Indeed, we're duly grateful to the Forum for the loan. It's no small thing to be lugging about, but I've always wanted to try it.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: If you are ready, Raha, you may proceed with measuring the aether of the phantom realm. Forename─please assist him, will you?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: In the meantime, I have a mind to further examine the monument with Snoegeim. How does that sound?

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Like a plan! As a matter of fact, I've already done a little bit of work on that front.

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: As you previously determined, the monument harbors some manner of magic. And this magic, I've since found, takes the form of an epigraph!

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: By consulting Professors Rurusha and Namono, Sharlayan's foremost experts in the field of archaeology, I was able to make a discovery.

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: By consulting experts in the field of archaeology, I was able to make a discovery.

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Oh yes, a most startling discovery!

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: ...That is, the epigraph is largely incomplete, so we can't read it.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: So you didn't make a discovery...?

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Ah, but see, establishing what one doesn't know is also an important step in research!

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: For a blessing, the language used doesn't appear to be completely unknown. If we can but fill in the missing information, it should be possible to make sense of it.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: But where do we even begin looking for such information?

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Why, we ask the gods themselves, of course!

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: By giving them the battle they desire, we're doing them a favor, are we not? That being the case, I daresay they would grace us with their presence if called. Please come with me!

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Oh, the things I would ask them if they really did appear...

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Now, going by astrology, the Heaven of Earth should be the next to open. And it just so happens I know the perfect incantation for this purpose!

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Open Mun-Tuy!

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: It's a time-honored charm passed down in Gridania, whose patron is Nophica, one of the deities said to dwell in the Heaven of Earth. Come, everyone─say it with me!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Open Mun-Tuy!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: ...Open Mun-Tuy.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: (-All-)Open Mun-Tuy!

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: (-Cheery Voice-)Hehe, what delightful children you are. I too have desired to speak with you.

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: B-By the Twelve! It's her! It's really her!

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: She looks precisely as depicted in legend! Amazing!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: 'Tis an honor to meet you, Nophica. If I may, what is it that you wish to speak about?

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: You seek to decipher the monument, do you not? If you face more of us in battle, I myself included, we shall grant you the key to unlocking that mystery.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: We would of course be much obliged for such a gift, but are you certain? The gods before were not exactly forthcoming with your secrets.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: Closely have we watched you from our respective sanctums. Watched as you faced us and pursued the truth with pure hearts and minds.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: In light of what we have seen, we have concluded thus:

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: Even should you uncover the monument's purpose, you would still be willing to lend us your aid.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: Help us to fulfill our heart's desire, and so too shall we grant you yours.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: I look forward to receiving you in my sanctum, my dear children.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Our efforts to understand the Twelve appear to have paid off.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: I wasn't expecting a god to actually appear. 'Twas but a coincidence, surely...

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: It worked! The charm reached the Matron! If it can be repeated, I shall have to mention it in my thesis!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: The original plan was to revisit the Heavens of Lightning and Fire...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: But I believe all would agree that we should prioritize Nophica's invitation.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Well, Snoegeim, your charm did the trick. The way to another heaven lies open, and beyond it the truth of the monument.

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: I can scarcely wait to pore over the aetheric data! Raha, Forename─I leave it in your capable hands!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: As for you, Deryk─may we rely on your guidance once more?

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Now that we know what awaits, I do not feel my presence is necessary; on the contrary, I would only be a burden.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: As you wish, of course.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: We can still count on you to pray for our friends, though, I trust?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I'm glad that I can join you this time, Forename.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Encumbered as I am with the analyzer, I fear I won't be able to assist in battle, but I shall do my part and secure the data we need!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Curious about my attire, are you? I borrowed it alongside the analyzer. It's the choice of gleaners, cleverly designed to help one bear great loads.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: And hefty as the analyzer is, by now I'm quite used to the feel of it. That's to say, I won't unduly slow you down. Come, let us set forth!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: In actually fighting the gods, yours is the hardest task of all.

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: The rest of us are truly grateful to you, and we shall do our utmost to support your efforts.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Knowing you, you should have no trouble finding your way without me. I will cheer you on from here.

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Thanks to the aetheric analyzer, even those who can't accompany you will have access to valuable data. Compliments to the Forum for the loan!

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: You're both safe, thank goodness!

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: You have the data, then? Wonderful, wonderful!

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: I don't suppose I could do the honors and replace the transcriber cartridge? I've always wanted to take a closer look!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Take care removing it, now. We don't want anything to happen to the data.

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Carefully does it... Come to me, O knowledge divine! Come to me!

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: (-???-)What is that?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Uwaaaaaah!

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Oh...

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: I-It's all right! Th-The cartridge is safe!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Let's finish the task before there are any more surprises...

dialogue.name: ALTHYK
dialogue.text: You have our gratitude for bringing us closer to achieving our dream.

dialogue.name: NYMEIA
dialogue.text: Oh, Althyk, must you always be so formal? Although he has trouble expressing it, I assure you, my brother is absolutely giddy with joy.

dialogue.name: HALONE
dialogue.text: Why are you here, Nophica? Have you not sufficiently amused yourself with the mortals?

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: Not nearly! I would talk to them some more.

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: Nophica promised you the key to deciphering the monument, did she not?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: Yes, that's correct.

dialogue.name: ALTHYK
dialogue.text: Then you would do well to hold in your minds that which harbors information.

dialogue.name: NYMEIA
dialogue.text: Come now, Brother, you need to speak plainer than that. To clarify, we shall create the objects you need, but your assistance is required to give them form.

dialogue.name: NYMEIA
dialogue.text: Worry not─appearance has no effect on function. Just try and imagine that which, in your minds, is used to hold information.

dialogue.name: NYMEIA
dialogue.text: There. These instruments shall be useful in your quest.

dialogue.name: ALTHYK
dialogue.text: Across Eorzea lie eternal stones that hold the information required to complete the words of the monument.

dialogue.name: ALTHYK
dialogue.text: By holding an instrument out to a stone, it will take that information unto itself.

dialogue.name: ALTHYK
dialogue.text: We scattered these stones across the realm that mortals would not uncover our secrets. Of late, however, 'twould seem you have found alternate uses for them as objects of worship.

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Could they be the marks of the Twelve!?

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: They are, aren't they? Oh, to think that they harbored information on the gods!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: It seems we have our next destinations. Aside from the three city-states, I believe the marks are located in Coerthas and Mor Dhona.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I propose we split up, the quicker to finish the task.

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: I wish to come too.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: No, Menphina. 'Twould not do to burden these children so.

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: After all this time, we finally have the chance to speak with mortals─to learn about them from up close. And we're not like to have another...

dialogue.name: HALONE
dialogue.text: I must say, I share Menphina's view.

dialogue.name: NOPHICA
dialogue.text: Even you, Halone...

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: I'd like to learn about you too, and I believe I speak for all of us! By all means, let us travel together!

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: Music to my ears! We shall watch over you and see that you safely reach your destinations. Without further ado, then...

dialogue.name: AZEYMA
dialogue.text: (-Azeyma-)Not so fast!

dialogue.name: AZEYMA
dialogue.text: (-Meerkat with Azeyma's Voice-)Did you think you could go frolicking without us? The others have our domain well in hand, so we are coming too.

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: Well now, far be it from us to stop you. Let us assume our disguises too, and then each choose a mortal to accompany!

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Please, let it be something inconspicuous...

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: Hm-hm! I believe my destination is Thanalan. Then it's La Noscea for Raha, the Twelveswood for Krile...

dialogue.name: SNOEGEIM
dialogue.text: And last but not least, Mor Dhona and Coerthas for Deryk and Forename.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Will you be all right, Krile?

dialogue.name: KRILE
dialogue.text: I shall be fine. You needn't worry.

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: Never before have I traveled with mortals. Ahhh, such fun this will be!

dialogue.name: HALONE
dialogue.text: Others will remain to keep watch over our domain. You needn't worry on our account.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: We abided by the gods' selections...but why do you suppose the two of us were grouped together?

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: Why, because you make the most intriguing pair. The gods-felling hero, and the world-faring explorer!

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: I shall relish the chance to learn about both of you!

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: Now then, the others have already set forth, so let us do the same. Aside from my own mark, I believe we'll find those of Thaliak and Halone in Mor Dhona and Coerthas.

dialogue.name: BABYOPOOPO
dialogue.text: Ook! Ook!

dialogue.name: MENPHINA
dialogue.text: Oh my, what an adorable creature! Delighted to meet you, little one.

dialogue.name: HALONE
dialogue.text: It seems to want to join us too.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: What an unusual company this has become... The gods truly know no inhibition.

dialogue.name: DERYK
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename. I couldn't have anticipated this turn of events...
